article.headline: Georgia Southern 68, W. Carolina 65
article.story: CULLOWHEE, N.C. -- Jelani Hewitt scored 18 points and a layup by Willie Powers III with 1:40 remaining put Georgia Southern ahead to stay in a 68-65 victory over Western Carolina on Saturday. Two free throws by Hewitt with 9 seconds left gave the Eagles (10-12, 8-4 Southern Conference) their final margin, and Preston Ross missed a 3-point try in the final second for the Catamounts (10-15, 4-8). Western Carolina led 52-46 with 10:50 left, but Georgia Southern scored the next seven points to go in front 53-52. Neither team led by more than three points the rest of the way in a game that featured 17 lead changes. Ben Drayton scored 14 points for the Eagles and Eric Ferguson had 13 points after being held scoreless in the first half. Keaton Cole led the Catamounts with 17 points and Harouna Mutombo had 16.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
